title: Most food workers admit working while sick
text:
Posted: 10:01 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 Most food workers admit working while sick Related 15% of workers said they would not serve the food they make to their own families. Sponsored Links 
A new survey reveals more than half of food industry workers in the US and Canada: go to work sick. 
The Center for Research and Public Policy polled 1200 people working in food processing plants, cafeterias, restaurants and grocery stores. 51-percent said they always or frequently go to work when they're sick. The most common reasons were a fear of lost wages and letting down fellow co-workers. Perhaps even more disturbing, 15-percent of workers said they would not serve the food they make to their own families. Sign up for our WPXI-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
